title: Linux fg Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux fg command and learn how to bring background processes to the foreground, manage multiple background processes, and optimize your workflow with practical examples.

meta.title: Linux fg Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux fg command and learn how to bring background processes to the foreground, manage multiple background processes, and optimize your workflow with practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, fg command, process management, background processes, foreground, workflow optimization

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the fg Command

verify.name: Verify the fg command brings a background process to the foreground
verify.hint: Make sure the `fg` command brings the background `sleep` process to the foreground. Check the process list to verify the process is now running in the foreground.

steps.title: Bring a Background Process to the Foreground

verify.name: Verify the fg command brings a background process to the foreground
verify.hint: Make sure the `fg` command brings the background `sleep` process to the foreground. Check the process list to verify the process is now running in the foreground, then interrupt the process to ensure you can interact with it.

steps.title: Manage Multiple Background Processes with fg

verify.name: Verify managing multiple background processes with fg
verify.hint: Make sure you can bring different background processes to the foreground using the `fg` command with job numbers and PIDs. Verify that the processes are now running in the foreground and that you can interact with them (e.g., by interrupting them).
